required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Is it Safe to do Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy for Acute Cholecystitis up to Seven Days?
clinical_study.official_title: Is it Safe to do Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy for Acute Cholecystitis up to Seven Days? A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives: To compare the safety of early (≤72h) versus late (>72h-7days) laparoscopic cholecystectomy (LC) from symptom onset for acute cholecystitis (AC).
Background: As LC within 72h of symptom onset was considered the optimum time, sometimes there was a delay in diagnosis and management. So, we raised the question of safety and feasibility of performing LC to patients with AC who failed to have LC within 72h of acute attack.
Patients and Methods: This was a prospective, randomized, double-blind, clinical trial; carried out on 120 patients presented with AC between September 2017 and April 2019. Patients were randomly allocated into two equal groups assigned to LC; group E: within 72h of symptom onset, and group L: after 72h up to seven days from symptom onset.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants and Rate of Post-operative complications
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants and Rate of: Post-operative bleeding, Fluid collection, Bile leak, Port-site infection, Revision surgery, Mortality rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean and Standard deviation of Operative duration (hours) (mean±SD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from surgical incision till suture closure
secondary_outcome.description: Mean and Standard deviation of Operative duration (hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean and Standard deviation of Intra-operative blood loss (ml) (mean±SD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from surgical incision till suture closure
secondary_outcome.description: Mean and Standard deviation of Intra-operative blood loss (ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants and Rate of Conversion to open cholecystectomy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start till the end of surgical procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants and Rate of Conversion to open cholecystectomy

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean and Standard deviation of Length of hospital stay (days) (mean±SD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from hospital admission till home discharge within 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Mean and Standard deviation of Length of hospital stay (days)

arm_group.description: Early laparoscopic cholecystectomy (within 72h from symptom onset)
Late laparoscopic cholecystectomy (after 72h up to seven days from symptom onset)

intervention.description: after 72h up to seven days from symptom onset

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with AC within seven days from symptom onset
- American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) physical status ≤ II
- Age from 21 to 60 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with ASA physical status > II
- Age < 21 years or > 60 years
- Child classification B or C
- Choledocholithiasis
- Acute pancreatitis
- Severe sepsis
- Gallbladder perforation
- Pregnant women
